Login Pitch Us an Idea Resources Contact Us Partner Login Pitch Us an Idea Resources CLOSE Partners | Contact Us | Share Contact Us The Visitors Information Center for Panama City Beach, Florida is located at 17001 Panama City Beach Parkway. The administrative offices are open 8 a.m. to 5 p.m., Monday through Friday. Call (850) 233-5070 to reach the administrative office or email info@visitpanamacitybeach.com . Toll Free: 1-800-PCBEACH (722-3224) Canadian Toll-Free: 1-800-553-1330 Public Records Request Public record requests for Panama City Beach Convention & Visitors Bureau, Inc. dba Visit Panama City Beach are to be submitted to: Ms. Sharon Cook, Director of Administration, and Records Custodian 17001 Panama City Beach Parkway, Panama City Beach, Florida 32413 (850) 233-5070 If you would like to submit a public records request via email, please email publicrecords@visitpanamacitybeach.com . Visit Panama City Beach Staff Here at the Real. FUN. Beach., we have a Real. FUN. Team! While we’re all unique in our own special ways, the team at Visit Panama City Beach share one thing in common: our love for Panama City Beach! Whether we’re reminiscing at PCB gems like Goofy Golf, grabbing the best seafood along the Gulf Coast at a beachfront restaurant or enjoying a boat ride to Shell Island, our staff knows just how to PCB! Take a look around and get to know us, and don’t forget to stop by and let us know how you PCB! Administration Dan Rowe President & CEO "I love looking at things from different perspectives. There is no better way to understand the lay of the land and feed my need for adventure than taking a ride with panhandle helicopters." Richard Sanders Vice President of Special Projects "From award winning cuisine to world class entertainment events, Panama City Beach offers it all!" Aaron Lee Vice President of Administration "Capt. Anderson’s is the perfect place for me to unwind with my friends & family while enjoying one of the most extensive and exclusive wine and champagne list in the country. It's always a great time at Capt. Anderson’s when you have a combination of good friends, great food & amazing wine" Sharon Cook Director of Administration "The reason I moved to PCB in 2008….The Salt Water! Adventures at Sea is the best place to have salty fun on the salty water." Terri Hogg Administrative Services Manager "For me there is no better way to experience a sunset than at Panama City Beach!" Julie Gordon Film Commissioner "Lights, Camera, & always so much action at the Real. Fun. Beach." Marketing Jayna Leach Senior VP of Marketing & Chief Marketing Officer "Real. FUN. Shopping at Pier Park with Baybee the Bully makes for the perfect day in PCB!" Michaelean Stewart Director of Interactive Marketing "There is nothing better than taking the boat out to Shell Island and enjoying the turquoise water of PCB!" Sydney Clifton Communications & Social Media Manager "From carefree weekends as a child to relaxing moments as an adult, St. Andrews State Park's jetties have always been my happy place." Antonia Scharpe Marketing Coordinator "Spending time with Ollie at the PCB dog beach is my favorite way to enjoy the day!" Special Events Patrick Stewart Director of Special Events "No better way to relax than fishing on the World's Most Beautiful Beaches." Paola Caballero Special Events Operations Manager "White sand beaches, clear blue waters, and endless sunshine—there’s no better place to soak up the beauty of Florida than right here in PCB!" Sage Mickey Special Events Coordinator "There is no better way to experience the true essence of Real Fun Beach than soaking up the sun in St. Andrews State Park." Sports Chris O'Brien Director of Sports Marketing "I love that you can go from the beach to birdwatching in the park in a matter of steps." Justin Kelley Sports Marketing Operations Manager "As a past college baseball player, I enjoy spending the weekend watching baseball at the Publix Sports Park!" Kristen Krasinskas Sports Business Development Manager "From playing kickball at Publix Sports Park to reading on the beach, you can find me outside enjoying the warm PCB sunshine!" Sales Steve Bailey Vice President of Sales "As a boating enthusiast, I love Chasin' The Sun in Panama City Beach!" Helen Adami Director of Destination Sales "Living in PCB means I'm just steps away from a tropical paradise." Lauren Jenkins Sales Coordinator "Tennis has always been a favorite activity of mine, and the courts at Frank Brown Park provide the perfect place for me to work on my serve! Just minutes away from the water, I love to wind down after a good match at the Real. Fun. Beach." Visitor Services Barrie Ainslie Director of Visitor Services "The beautiful lodge & moss covered oak trees at Camp Helen offer a unique side of Panama City Beach." Traci Smith Visitor Information Specialist "Dat Cajun Place-one of my favorite places on the beach that makes me feel like I’m “back home”." Bill Poteet Visitor Information Specialist "The Pier at St. Andrews State park provides views of both the natural beauty of Panama City Beach, and its modern skyline." Leah Blissitt Visitor Services Specialist "Pier Park is my entertainment go to place for REAL FUN, and the beach is right across the street." Pam Swafford Visitor Services Specialist "Growing up here in the 70s meant meeting friends at the County Pier and spending endless hours in the sun, sand, and surf!  The County Pier is a great place to make memories!" Contact Us Media Film Office Partners Sitemap Privacy Policy Real.Fun.Beach.Store © 2025 Travel PCB 17001 Panama City Beach Pkwy, Panama City Beach, FL 32413 * Phone: 850-233-5070 * Toll Free: 1-800-722-3224

Staff & Board of Directors - Diamond Head Theatre Skip to content Box Office: (808) 733-0274 | Business Office: (808) 733-0277 Facebook Instagram YouTube LinkedIn Email Search for: Shows & Tickets Buy Tickets Season Subscriptions Seat Map Show Archive Subscriber Login Donate Annual Giving Capital Campaign Producer’s Club Sponsorship ‘Ilima Awards Auditions Show Auditions Shooting Stars Classes Year-Round Classes Summer Musical Theatre Experience Shooting Stars Instructors Scholarships About Staff & Board of Directors Instructors Volunteer Rentals News Show Archive Your New Theatre Theatrical Arts Building Make a Gift Sponsor a Seat Photos News Capital Campaign Donors Contact BUY TICKETS Staff & Board of Directors Jacque Vaughn 2025-07-23T06:29:51-10:00 STAFF & BOARD OF DIRECTORS We bring the magic of theatre to all Trevor Tamashiro, Executive Director Trevor joined Diamond Head Theatre as Executive Director in April 2023. Born and raised in Hawaii, and a graduate of Punahou School, he brings nearly 20 years of experience in nonprofit executive leadership. Trevor started his journey in New York City working for Broadway Dance Center. Other positions include: Chief Advancement Officer of The Diller-Quaile School of Music; Deputy Director of Saratoga International Theater Institute; and Deputy/Program Director for The Drama League of New York. Trevor is a member of the Association of Fundraising Professionals and is a Certified Fund Raising Executive (CFRE). He holds a degree in Theatre Arts from University of Miami, a Master of Business Administration degree from Pace University, and a Master of Science degree in Nonprofit Management from Columbia University. John Rampage, Artistic Director John Rampage is a performer, actor, choreographer, and director who has served as Diamond Head Theatre’s Artistic Director since 1995. He is the creative mastermind behind all of the theatre’s productions and programs, overseeing the curation of two or more shows each season and selects directors, musical directors, and set designers. His relationship with the theatre began in 1975 where he performed as Tommy Gilas in the 1975 production of Music Man. In the 1980s, Rampage danced and sang his way across the U.S. and Europe and returned in 1991 as choreographer of Evita. More than 120 productions have been shared with the community under his oversight. A 47-time Po‘okela Award winner for excellence in the theatre, John is also the recipient of the Hawaii State Theatre Council 2006 Pierre Bowman Award.
